tweets.text:
As part of #OpClampdown, our fisheries team have been patrolling the River Dee #Cheshire with @cheshirepolice to combat illegal #fishing during the course fish close season. 

If you see or suspect illegal fishing activity report it to our hotline on 0800 807060 https://t.co/KgQAYmtOKe
Check out this latest video https://t.co/7ItU3DBPZR   introducing an exciting long-term project for the coastal frontage between #HurstSpit and #Lymington @newforestdc @NaturalEngland @JBAConsulting

We are working with @EnvAgency  and  @FOIM_IlkleyMoor on a natural flood management  project to slow the flow of water from Ilkley Moor into Backstone Beck which flows into the River Wharfe. This work will also help peat bogs to form which store carbon.   https://t.co/Eh3svE5omT https://t.co/TtOAlMqpSr

urls.title: Measures to reduce harm from storm overflows to be made law
urls.description: New legal duties on water companies and government will reduce sewage discharged into waterways.

tweets.text:
It's vitally important we protect our rivers.
That's why we're creating new legal duties on water companies and government to reduce the amount of sewage discharged into our waterways.
Find out more: https://t.co/ofgpkeZ0eN https://t.co/RoiNLfCUMI
@SE_Rivers_Trust @CarshaltonHigh @theriverstrust @Thames_RvrsTrst @SuttonCouncil @EnvAgency Looks great 🍀🌾🌿🌦. We hope susdrain can have a case study in due course. Please also nominate a #sudschamp
@CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Well done patrol. I particularly like them having to clear it up. It’s a real worry, what kind of people they will become.

There’s no smell, there’s no smell, there’s no smell, there’s no smell, there’s no smell, there’s no smell, there’s no smell, there’s a smell but it’s not us @RedIndustries2 !! @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency https://t.co/0UE5Ut2FvV

@Slezmass @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 Definitely on the page of doing own independent testing where possible. The town are at the point where we no longer trust the @EnvAgency or feel they are acting in our best interests. What are you going to do about it @MPGeorgeEustice ? @StinkStopthe

Today 25 pioneering projects have received a share of £150 million of funding to test new approaches to flood risk management in a #ClimateCrisis. Here’s my blog about the whole programme: https://t.co/FK8ljCD0yj #adaptourworld #COP26 #TogetherforOurPlanet https://t.co/MJTTuIb4Ck

This week is #WorldAutismAwarenessWeek the EA are celebrating this with various activities all week .Approx 1 in 100 people are autistic but only 22% are in employment . @EnvAgencySE @MoretonBack1 @wifo_ea @johncurtinEA @JohnLeylandEA

urls.title: More than 300,000 homes better protected from flooding since 2015
urls.description: The Environment Agency and partners have completed more than 700 projects to better protect more than 300,000 homes since 2015

tweets.text: 300,000 homes in England are now better protected against flooding. 27,000 of those homes are in the South West, including the  #Helston flood alleviation scheme in #Cornwall which provides increased protection for 121 homes. #FCERM #TeamEA https://t.co/1z6QDFYyBo https://t.co/qqAk6vI7Y3
@StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 Best thing do is get a sample and get it tested at keele see what poison is in that water

@StinkStopthe my friend in London after doing a little research on what’s going on after I was telling her about how awful it’s been . With particular focus on the ‘gas monitors’ 🔌  her take https://t.co/eFw7ctrDnA

OPEN LETTER TO RED INDUSTRIES

Following the Environment Agency's finding of a significant breach, Red Industries need to:

(a) outline how they are going to alleviate the ongoing odour

(b) explain what compensation they plan to offer to affected residents https://t.co/rv1098PULt

@AaronBell4NUL I fear we are at a tipping point and unless @RedIndustries2, @ClareDinnisEA and @EnvAgencyMids get a grip, the situation will deteriorate. I don't get the impression there will be any illegal direct action but people have had enough of being ignored by official agencies.

tweets.text: @pow_rebecca @Dunne4Ludlow @DefraGovUK There are regulations already in place to penalise sewage dumping (and run off from agribusiness). The problem is the @EnvAgency hardly ever enforce the rules, so water companies pollute with impunity. Rivers are cheap sewers for @WaterUK

@JMHessenauer @Green1Amy @sceneUofG @EnvAgency @vemcoteam It's a @C_Adams1758 design! It's a chain link (scrap metal ship anchor chain), they come in various sizes but we use either 20 kg or 38 kg. On it we weld rebar to create a stand; three bits of rebar for strength. This is our preferred mooring for rivers and very shallow lakes. https://t.co/bDU2mjotXB

Disgraceful pollution incident on the River Roding right now: a @thameswater pipe is spewing 10k’s litres of raw sewage a day into the Aldersbrook & the Roding. It is due to badly designed & maintained sewage systems & they have no idea how long it’s been going on for. https://t.co/JyQdqAfSSx
This is so joyful and full of hope. A inspirational view of what cam be done if we put our minds to it #spongecities https://t.co/P3VEnM4qqU

@CumbriaRain @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng Coupled with 60mph wind gusts throughout the county and 80mph on the hills you would have thought a warning would have been issued. Certainly had them for less. Thanks for Sharing Rainfall data !!

#floodaware #floodrisk https://t.co/cPz4mDhiaZ

tweets.text: @Wooooller @CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Gosh yes, what an usual national costume they are wearing! How did I never spot that before? British people would never wear trakkie bottoms and puffer jackets. Clutching at straws, mate.

@miss_squiddy @CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency I know British people would do it, I see lots of people fly tipping or stealing catalytic converters off cars, most of them not British. And they are not British mate, look how they’re dressed. Not you’re going to tell me I can’t tell where someone is from by how they are dressed

@Wooooller @CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency I don't think you're right. As everyone currently in the country must live here and the majority of people living in Britain are British, why would you look at this photo and automatically assume they are foreign? Because you think British people wouldn't do this. They would.
@bvanveelen Tree planting also seemed to be the main idea the PM latched onto for improving #FloodResilience https://t.co/w50jkcwc80

@miss_squiddy @CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Don’t go thinking that I don’t think brits are arseholes as well, I never said that, you’re just trying to make me look bad and make something out of nothing. All I said was, I bet they’re not British, and I think I’m right, and I think you know I am too.
